title: requesting cuda on OSX fails
body:
If you have a cuda dependency on OSX spack seems to fetch linux cuda runtime. 

```
==> Installing cuda
==> Fetching https://developer.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/9.0/Prod/local_installers/cuda_9.0.176_384.81_linux-run
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Already staged cuda-9.0.176-46cahgpcwtgwlktx6jkfhatrtsisdajd in /Users/harrison37/Work/alpine/spack/var/spack/stage/cuda-9.0.176-46cahgpcwtgwlktx6jkfhatrtsisdajd
==> No patches needed for cuda
==> Building cuda [Package]
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 255:
    '/Users/harrison37/Work/alpine/spack/var/spack/stage/cuda-9.0.176-46cahgpcwtgwlktx6jkfhatrtsisdajd/cuda_9.0.176_384.81_linux-run' '--silent' '--verbose' '--override' '--toolkit' '--toolkitpath=/Users/harrison37/Work/alpine/spack/opt/spack/darwin-elcapitan-x86_64/clang-7.3.0-apple/cuda-9.0.176-46cahgpcwtgwlktx6jkfhatrtsisdajd'

1 error found in build log:
     [ ... ]
  >> 4     cat: /etc/issue: No such file or directory

```

Thats not good, but I am secretly hoping someone can share an example `packages.yml` file that demonstrates how to use a system install of cuda on OSX.
